ProjectTitle: Using a natural speech paradigm to define neural restoration or compensation in persons with aphasia
InitialFeedbackHistory:
13/07/2022
7. Sharing: What is the reason not to share any data? Most repositories give you the option to restrict access to your data files but others can easily find your datasets thanks to the associated metadata and you receive a DOI or accession number to list in your publications which may make collaboration easier. Usually disciplinary repositories (for example openneuro, neurovault, ebrains, GIN) are a good place to share but also to preserve your data, and you can also use the KU Leuven repository RDR (www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr)
label: good with suggestions
